page.title: 01Louth, Lincolnshire
page.content: Louth,(pop.approx.13,000) is one of Lincolnshire's smaller towns but nevertheless a place of importance for agriculture and industry.It stands on the River Lud on the eastern slopes of the Lincolnshire Wolds,overlooking Marshland which extends 10 miles to the east coast.Dominating the town is the beautiful spire of the ancient parish church-but this is only 1 of many old and interesting buildings. Situated in one of the most advanced and productive farming areas of the world,Louth is of course a market town,retaining much of the tradition of the rural community of which it is a focal point.It does not,however, dwell too much on the past,witness the bypass soon to be built,the industrial and trading estate developments now well under way and the redevelopment of its education system.f
